title: Andy Robertson fires warning to Liverpool stars ahead of Manchester United clash
text:
Andy Robertson has warned his team-mates ahead of Liverpool’s trip to Man Utd (Picture: Getty)

Andy Robertson has warned his Liverpool team-mates that form will count for nothing when they face struggling Premier League rivals Manchester United.

Jurgen Klopp’s Premier League leaders travel to Old Trafford on Sunday afternoon 15 points above Manchester United in the table.

While Liverpool are yet to taste defeat in the Premier League this season, Ole Gunnar Solskjaer’s United have won just two of their eight fixtures and could drop into the relegation zone this weekend.

The Premier League leaders travel to Old Trafford on Sunday (Picture: Getty)

But Scotland captain Robertson said: ‘I don’t think it matters what your form is like in these games. It doesn’t matter that we’ve won eight on the bounce and they’re struggling.

‘It’s Man United v Liverpool. It will be a one-off game and we’ll see who comes out on top.’

On Liverpool’s rivalry with Manchester United, Robertson added: I think what makes it so special is that it’s historic.

‘There have been such great battles down the years. And they’ve always had top teams who have always fought against each other for everything on the pitch.

‘It’s always like that. And it’s genuinely a different atmosphere when you play against them. It’s a historic stadium, nice, though I prefer Anfield…

‘The atmosphere is good, too. There is always an edge to it. It’s a proper game and, sometimes, it gets played like a cup tie…

‘I have no doubt that they’ll produce a reaction after a poor performance against Newcastle.

‘I’m absolutely sure that they will be firing and wanting to kick-start their season. For them, there would be no better time to do it than against us.

‘But we have our own objectives and our own aims. That’s what we’ve got to be striving for.’
